intro: Eurybia fulvida, commonly known as the golden New Zealand bellflower, is a flowering plant native to New Zealand. It belongs to the Asteraceae family and is characterized by its striking yellow-orange flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. The plant typically grows in coastal areas and is adapted to sandy or rocky soils. Its leaves are lance-shaped and covered in a fine layer of white hairs, which help reduce water loss. Eurybia fulvida is a perennial herb that plays an important ecological role in its native habitat.
